Abstract: Large reasoning models (LRMs) have emerged as a powerful paradigm for solving complex real-world tasks. In practice, these models are predominantly trained via Reinforcement Learning with Verifiable Rewards (RLVR), yet most existing outcome-only RLVR pipelines rely almost exclusively on a binary correctness signal and largely ignore the model's intrinsic uncertainty. We term this discrepancy the uncertainty-reward mismatch, under which high- and low-uncertainty solutions are treated equivalently, preventing the policy from "Know What You Know" and impeding the shift from optimizing for correct answers to optimizing effective reasoning paths. This limitation is especially critical in reasoning-centric tasks such as mathematics and question answering, where performance hinges on the quality of the model's internal reasoning process rather than mere memorization of final answers. To address this, we propose EGPO, a metacognitive entropy calibration framework that explicitly integrates intrinsic uncertainty into RLVR for enhancing LRMs. EGPO estimates per-sample uncertainty using a zero-overhead entropy proxy derived from token-level likelihoods and aligns it with extrinsic correctness through an asymmetric calibration mechanism that preserves correct reasoning while selectively regulating overconfident failures, thereby enabling stable and uncertainty-aware policy optimization. Moreover, EGPO recovers informative learning signals from otherwise degenerate group-based rollouts without modifying the verifier or reward definition. Extensive experiments across multiple benchmarks demonstrate that the proposed EGPO leads to substantial and consistent improvements in reasoning performance, establishing a principled path for advancing LRMs through metacognitive entropy calibration.

zh.title: 了解你所知：可验证RL推理的元认知熵校准
zh.summary: 该论文引入了EGPO，通过显式地将内在信心水平集成到强化学习训练中，解决了大型推理模型中的"不确定性-奖励不匹配"问题。这使得能够更有效地优化推理质量，而不仅仅是正确答案，提高了数学和问答任务的性能。

fr.title: Sachez ce que vous savez : Calibrage d'entropie métacognitive pour le raisonnement RL vérifiable
fr.summary: L'article présente EGPO, qui aborde le « décalage incertitude-récompense » dans les grands modèles de raisonnement en intégrant explicitement les niveaux de confiance intrinsèques dans l'entraînement par renforcement. Cela permet une optimisation plus efficace de la qualité du raisonnement plutôt que simplement des réponses correctes, améliorant les performances sur les tâches mathématiques et de réponse aux questions.

de.title: Wissen, was du weißt: Metakognitive Entropie-Kalibrierung für verifizierbares RL-Reasoning
de.summary: Das Papier stellt EGPO vor, das das „Unsicherheit-Belohnungs-Missverhältnis" in großen Reasoning-Modellen durch explizite Integration von innewohnenden Vertrauensstufen in das Verstärkungslerntraining angeht. Dies ermöglicht eine effektivere Optimierung der Reasoning-Qualität statt nur korrekter Antworten und verbessert die Leistung bei mathematischen und Frage-Antwort-Aufgaben.

es.title: Sabe lo que sabe: Calibración de entropía metacognitiva para razonamiento RL verificable
es.summary: El documento presenta EGPO, que aborda la "desajuste incertidumbre-recompensa" en modelos de razonamiento grandes al integrar explícitamente niveles de confianza intrínsecos en el entrenamiento de aprendizaje por refuerzo. Esto permite una optimización más efectiva de la calidad del razonamiento en lugar de solo respuestas correctas, mejorando el desempeño en tareas de matemáticas y respuesta a preguntas.

title: Decomposing Physician Disagreement in HealthBench
summary: Analysis of the HealthBench medical AI dataset reveals that physician disagreement is dominated (81.8%) by case-level factors rather than evaluation rubric interpretation, with borderline outputs driving most disagreement. Missing contextual information more than doubles disagreement likelihood, suggesting evaluation design improvements could reduce ambiguity where clinical uncertainty cannot.
content:
arXiv:2602.22758v1 Announce Type: new 
Abstract: We decompose physician disagreement in the HealthBench medical AI evaluation dataset to understand where variance resides and what observable features can explain it. Rubric identity accounts for 15.8% of met/not-met label variance but only 3.6-6.9% of disagreement variance; physician identity accounts for just 2.4%. The dominant 81.8% case-level residual is not reduced by HealthBench's metadata labels (z = -0.22, p = 0.83), normative rubric language (pseudo R^2 = 1.2%), medical specialty (0/300 Tukey pairs significant), surface-feature triage (AUC = 0.58), or embeddings (AUC = 0.485). Disagreement follows an inverted-U with completion quality (AUC = 0.689), confirming physicians agree on clearly good or bad outputs but split on borderline cases. Physician-validated uncertainty categories reveal that reducible uncertainty (missing context, ambiguous phrasing) more than doubles disagreement odds (OR = 2.55, p < 10^(-24)), while irreducible uncertainty (genuine medical ambiguity) has no effect (OR = 1.01, p = 0.90), though even the former explains only ~3% of total variance. The agreement ceiling in medical AI evaluation is thus largely structural, but the reducible/irreducible dissociation suggests that closing information gaps in evaluation scenarios could lower disagreement where inherent clinical ambiguity does not, pointing toward actionable evaluation design improvements.

zh.title: HealthBench中医生意见分歧的分解分析
zh.summary: 对HealthBench医学AI数据集的分析表明，医生意见分歧主要（81.8%）由病例层面因素而非评估规则解释主导，边界输出驱动大部分分歧。缺失的上下文信息使分歧可能性增加一倍多，表明评估设计改进可以在无法消除临床不确定性的地方减少歧义。

fr.title: Décomposition du désaccord entre médecins dans HealthBench
fr.summary: L'analyse de l'ensemble de données HealthBench d'IA médicale révèle que le désaccord entre médecins est dominé (81,8%) par des facteurs au niveau des cas plutôt que par l'interprétation des critères d'évaluation, les résultats limites entraînant la plupart des désaccords. L'information contextuelle manquante double la probabilité de désaccord, suggérant que les améliorations de la conception de l'évaluation pourraient réduire l'ambiguïté là où l'incertitude clinique ne peut pas être supprimée.

de.title: Zerlegung der Ärzte-Uneinigkeit in HealthBench
de.summary: Die Analyse des HealthBench-Datensatzes für medizinische KI zeigt, dass Ärzte-Uneinigkeit (81,8%) durch Faktoren auf Fall-Ebene und nicht durch die Interpretation von Bewertungskriterien dominiert wird, wobei Grenzfallleistungen die meisten Uneinigkeiten verursachen. Fehlende kontextuelle Informationen verdoppeln die Wahrscheinlichkeit von Uneinigkeit, was darauf hindeutet, dass Verbesserungen des Bewertungsdesigns die Mehrdeutigkeit dort reduzieren könnten, wo klinische Unsicherheit nicht beseitigt werden kann.

es.title: Descomposición de la discrepancia entre médicos en HealthBench
es.summary: El análisis del conjunto de datos HealthBench de IA médica revela que el desacuerdo entre médicos es dominado (81,8%) por factores a nivel de casos en lugar de interpretación de rúbricas de evaluación, con resultados limítrofes impulsando la mayoría de desacuerdos. La información contextual faltante más que duplica la probabilidad de desacuerdo, sugiriendo que las mejoras en el diseño de evaluación podrían reducir la ambigüedad donde la incertidumbre clínica no se puede eliminar.

title: AMA-Bench: Evaluating Long-Horizon Memory for Agentic Applications
summary: AMA-Bench introduces the first comprehensive evaluation framework for long-horizon memory in autonomous agents, using real and synthetic trajectories to test LLM retention and retrieval across machine-generated interactions. The proposed AMA-Agent system achieves superior performance by incorporating causality-aware memory design and tool-augmented retrieval mechanisms.
content:
arXiv:2602.22769v1 Announce Type: new 
Abstract: Large Language Models (LLMs) are deployed as autonomous agents in increasingly complex applications, where enabling long-horizon memory is critical for achieving strong performance. However, a significant gap exists between practical applications and current evaluation standards for agent memory: existing benchmarks primarily focus on dialogue-centric, human-agent interactions. In reality, agent memory consists of a continuous stream of agent-environment interactions that are primarily composed of machine-generated representations. To bridge this gap, we introduce AMA-Bench (Agent Memory with Any length), which evaluates long-horizon memory for LLMs in real agentic applications. It features two key components: (1) a set of real-world agentic trajectories across representative agentic applications, paired with expert-curated QA, and (2) a set of synthetic agentic trajectories that scale to arbitrary horizons, paired with rule-based QA. Our comprehensive study shows that existing memory systems underperform on AMA-Bench primarily because they lack causality and objective information and are constrained by the lossy nature of similarity-based retrieval employed by many memory systems. To address these limitations, we propose AMA-Agent, an effective memory system featuring a causality graph and tool-augmented retrieval. Our results demonstrate that AMA-Agent achieves 57.22% average accuracy on AMA-Bench, surpassing the strongest memory system baselines by 11.16%.

zh.title: AMA-Bench：评估智能应用的长范围记忆
zh.summary: AMA-Bench为自主代理中的长范围记忆引入了第一个综合评估框架，使用真实和合成轨迹来测试LLM在机器生成交互中的保留和检索。提议的AMA-Agent系统通过整合因果感知记忆设计和工具增强的检索机制实现卓越性能。

fr.title: AMA-Bench : Évaluer la mémoire à long terme pour les applications d'agents
fr.summary: AMA-Bench introduit le premier cadre d'évaluation complet pour la mémoire à long terme dans les agents autonomes, utilisant des trajectoires réelles et synthétiques pour tester la rétention et la récupération des LLM dans les interactions générées par machine. Le système AMA-Agent proposé atteint des performances supérieures en incorporant une conception de mémoire sensible à la causalité et des mécanismes de récupération augmentés par des outils.

de.title: AMA-Bench: Bewertung des Langzeit-Gedächtnisses für agentenbasierte Anwendungen
de.summary: AMA-Bench führt das erste umfassende Bewertungsrahmenwerk für das Langzeit-Gedächtnis in autonomen Agenten ein und verwendet reale und synthetische Trajektorien zum Testen der Retention und des Abrufs von LLM über maschinell generierte Interaktionen. Das vorgeschlagene AMA-Agent-System erreicht überlegene Leistung durch die Einbeziehung kausaler Gedächtnisgestaltung und werkzeuggestützter Abrukmechanismen.

es.title: AMA-Bench: Evaluación de la memoria a largo horizonte para aplicaciones agentes
es.summary: AMA-Bench introduce el primer marco de evaluación integral para la memoria a largo horizonte en agentes autónomos, utilizando trayectorias reales y sintéticas para probar la retención y recuperación de LLM en interacciones generadas por máquina. El sistema AMA-Agent propuesto logra un desempeño superior al incorporar un diseño de memoria consciente de la causalidad y mecanismos de recuperación aumentados por herramientas.

title: ClinDet-Bench: Beyond Abstention, Evaluating Judgment Determinability of LLMs in Clinical Decision-Making
summary: ClinDet-Bench evaluates whether large language models can correctly recognize when clinical decisions are impossible to make safely with available information, surfacing critical safety gaps where LLMs either conclude prematurely or abstain unnecessarily. The benchmark provides frameworks for assessing LLM judgment determinability in high-stakes scenarios.
content:
arXiv:2602.22771v1 Announce Type: new 
Abstract: Clinical decisions are often required under incomplete information. Clinical experts must identify whether available information is sufficient for judgment, as both premature conclusion and unnecessary abstention can compromise patient safety. To evaluate this capability of large language models (LLMs), we developed ClinDet-Bench, a benchmark based on clinical scoring systems that decomposes incomplete-information scenarios into determinable and undeterminable conditions. Identifying determinability requires considering all hypotheses about missing information, including unlikely ones, and verifying whether the conclusion holds across them. We find that recent LLMs fail to identify determinability under incomplete information, producing both premature judgments and excessive abstention, despite correctly explaining the underlying scoring knowledge and performing well under complete information. These findings suggest that existing benchmarks are insufficient to evaluate the safety of LLMs in clinical settings. ClinDet-Bench provides a framework for evaluating determinability recognition, leading to appropriate abstention, with potential applicability to medicine and other high-stakes domains, and is publicly available.

zh.title: ClinDet-Bench：超越弃权，评估LLMs在临床决策中的判断确定性
zh.summary: ClinDet-Bench评估大型语言模型是否能够正确识别何时临床决策在可用信息下无法安全进行，揭示LLMs要么过早下结论要么不必要弃权的关键安全漏洞。该基准为评估高风险场景中LLM判断确定性提供了框架。

fr.title: ClinDet-Bench : Au-delà de l'abstention, évaluation de la capacité de jugement des LLMs dans la prise de décision clinique
fr.summary: ClinDet-Bench évalue si les grands modèles de langage peuvent correctement reconnaître quand les décisions cliniques ne peuvent pas être prises en toute sécurité avec les informations disponibles, mettant au jour des lacunes de sécurité critiques où les LLMs concluent prématurément ou s'abstiennent inutilement. L'indice de référence fournit des cadres pour évaluer la capacité de jugement des LLM dans des scénarios à enjeux élevés.

de.title: ClinDet-Bench: Über die Enthaltung hinaus, Bewertung der Beurteilungsbestimmbarkeit von LLMs in der klinischen Entscheidungsfindung
de.summary: ClinDet-Bench bewertet, ob große Sprachmodelle korrekt erkennen können, wann klinische Entscheidungen nicht sicher mit den verfügbaren Informationen getroffen werden können, und offenbart kritische Sicherheitslücken, bei denen LLMs entweder vorzeitig zu Schlussfolgerungen kommen oder sich unnötigerweise enthalten. Die Benchmark bietet Rahmen zur Bewertung der Beurteilungsbestimmbarkeit von LLMs in Szenarien mit hohem Einsatz.

es.title: ClinDet-Bench: Más allá de la abstención, evaluación de la determinabilidad de juicio de LLMs en la toma de decisiones clínicas
es.summary: ClinDet-Bench evalúa si los grandes modelos de lenguaje pueden reconocer correctamente cuándo las decisiones clínicas no se pueden tomar de manera segura con la información disponible, exponiendo brechas críticas de seguridad donde los LLMs concluyen prematuramente o se abstienen innecesariamente. El punto de referencia proporciona marcos para evaluar la determinabilidad del juicio de LLM en escenarios de alto riesgo.

title: MiroFlow: Towards High-Performance and Robust Open-Source Agent Framework for General Deep Research Tasks
summary: MiroFlow is an open-source agent framework achieving state-of-the-art results across multiple benchmarks through improved agent orchestration and robust workflow execution, offering an accessible alternative to expensive commercial API-dependent systems. The framework consistently outperforms existing solutions on diverse research task benchmarks without heavy reliance on commercial APIs.
content:
arXiv:2602.22808v1 Announce Type: new 
Abstract: Despite the remarkable progress of large language models (LLMs), the capabilities of standalone LLMs have begun to plateau when tackling real-world, complex tasks that require interaction with external tools and dynamic environments. Although recent agent frameworks aim to enhance model autonomy through tool integration and external interaction, they still suffer from naive workflows, unstable performance, limited support across diverse benchmarks and tasks, and heavy reliance on costly commercial APIs. In this work, we propose a high-performance and robust open-source agent framework, termed MiroFlow, which incorporates an agent graph for flexible orchestration, an optional deep reasoning mode to enhance performance, and a robust workflow execution to ensure stable and reproducible performance. Extensive experiments demonstrate that MiroFlow consistently achieves state-of-the-art performance across multiple agent benchmarks, including GAIA, BrowseComp-EN/ZH, HLE, xBench-DeepSearch, and notably FutureX. We hope it could serve as an easily accessible, reproducible, and comparable baseline for the deep research community.

zh.title: MiroFlow: 面向通用深度研究任务的高性能鲁棒开源代理框架
zh.summary: MiroFlow是一个开源代理框架，通过改进的代理编排和鲁棒的工作流执行在多个基准测试中实现了最先进的结果，为昂贵的商业API依赖系统提供了可访问的替代方案。该框架在多样化的研究任务基准测试中始终优于现有解决方案，且不依赖商业API。

fr.title: MiroFlow : Vers un framework d'agent open-source robuste et haute performance pour les tâches générales de recherche approfondie
fr.summary: MiroFlow est un framework d'agent open-source qui réalise des résultats de pointe sur plusieurs benchmarks grâce à une orchestration d'agent améliorée et une exécution de flux de travail robuste, offrant une alternative accessible aux systèmes coûteux dépendants des API commerciales. Le framework surpasse systématiquement les solutions existantes sur des benchmarks de tâches de recherche diverses sans dépendre fortement des API commerciales.

de.title: MiroFlow: Ein hochleistungs- und robustes Open-Source-Agent-Framework für allgemeine tiefe Forschungsaufgaben
de.summary: MiroFlow ist ein Open-Source-Agent-Framework, das durch verbesserte Agent-Orchestrierung und robuste Workflow-Ausführung modernste Ergebnisse über mehrere Benchmarks hinweg erzielt und eine zugängliche Alternative zu teuren, kommerziellen API-abhängigen Systemen bietet. Das Framework übertrifft konsistent bestehende Lösungen bei vielfältigen Forschungsaufgaben-Benchmarks ohne starke Abhängigkeit von kommerziellen APIs.

es.title: MiroFlow: Hacia un framework de agente de código abierto de alto rendimiento y robusto para tareas generales de investigación profunda
es.summary: MiroFlow es un framework de agente de código abierto que logra resultados de última generación en múltiples puntos de referencia mediante orquestación mejorada de agentes y ejecución robusta del flujo de trabajo, ofreciendo una alternativa accesible a los costosos sistemas dependientes de API comerciales. El framework supera consistentemente las soluciones existentes en puntos de referencia de tareas de investigación diversos sin una fuerte dependencia de las API comerciales.

title: When Should an AI Act? A Human-Centered Model of Scene, Context, and Behavior for Agentic AI Design
summary: The paper proposes a conceptual model for designing proactive agentic AI that distinguishes between observable situations and user-interpreted meaning, yielding five design principles governing intervention depth, timing, and intensity. This framework helps AI systems act with contextual sensitivity rather than applying predetermined decision rules.
content:
arXiv:2602.22814v1 Announce Type: new 
Abstract: Agentic AI increasingly intervenes proactively by inferring users' situations from contextual data yet often fails for lack of principled judgment about when, why, and whether to act. We address this gap by proposing a conceptual model that reframes behavior as an interpretive outcome integrating Scene (observable situation), Context (user-constructed meaning), and Human Behavior Factors (determinants shaping behavioral likelihood). Grounded in multidisciplinary perspectives across the humanities, social sciences, HCI, and engineering, the model separates what is observable from what is meaningful to the user and explains how the same scene can yield different behavioral meanings and outcomes. To translate this lens into design action, we derive five agent design principles (behavioral alignment, contextual sensitivity, temporal appropriateness, motivational calibration, and agency preservation) that guide intervention depth, timing, intensity, and restraint. Together, the model and principles provide a foundation for designing agentic AI systems that act with contextual sensitivity and judgment in interactions.

zh.title: AI何时应该采取行动？面向代理式AI设计的以人为中心的场景、上下文和行为模型
zh.summary: 该论文提出了一个用于设计主动代理式AI的概念模型，该模型区分可观察的情景和用户解释的意义，产生了五个设计原则，控制干预的深度、时机和强度。该框架帮助AI系统以上下文敏感性行动，而不是应用预先确定的决策规则。

fr.title: Quand une IA doit-elle agir ? Un modèle centré sur l'humain de scène, contexte et comportement pour la conception d'IA agentique
fr.summary: L'article propose un modèle conceptuel pour la conception d'une IA agentique proactive qui distingue les situations observables de la signification interprétée par l'utilisateur, produisant cinq principes de conception régissant la profondeur, le moment et l'intensité de l'intervention. Ce cadre aide les systèmes d'IA à agir avec une sensibilité contextuelle plutôt que d'appliquer des règles de décision prédéterminées.

de.title: Wann sollte eine KI handeln? Ein menschenzentriertes Modell von Szenario, Kontext und Verhalten für das Design von agentischer KI
de.summary: Das Papier schlägt ein konzeptionelles Modell für die Gestaltung von proaktiver agentischer KI vor, das zwischen beobachtbaren Situationen und benutzerdefinierter Bedeutung unterscheidet und fünf Designprinzipien liefert, die Eingriffstiefen, -zeitpunkt und -intensität regeln. Dieses Framework hilft KI-Systemen, mit kontextabhängiger Empfindlichkeit zu handeln, anstatt vordefinierte Entscheidungsregeln anzuwenden.

es.title: ¿Cuándo debe actuar una IA? Un modelo centrado en el ser humano de escena, contexto y comportamiento para el diseño de IA agentiva
es.summary: El artículo propone un modelo conceptual para diseñar IA agentiva proactiva que distingue entre situaciones observables y significado interpretado por el usuario, generando cinco principios de diseño que rigen la profundidad, el momento e intensidad de la intervención. Este marco ayuda a los sistemas de IA a actuar con sensibilidad contextual en lugar de aplicar reglas de decisión predeterminadas.

title: FlexMS is a flexible framework for benchmarking deep learning-based mass spectrum prediction tools in metabolomics
summary: FlexMS provides a flexible benchmarking framework for evaluating deep learning models in mass spectrum prediction for drug discovery and materials science applications. The framework enables systematic assessment of model architectures across diverse datasets and metrics, revealing how data diversity, hyperparameters, and transfer learning affect prediction performance.
content:
arXiv:2602.22822v1 Announce Type: new 
Abstract: The identification and property prediction of chemical molecules is of central importance in the advancement of drug discovery and material science, where the tandem mass spectrometry technology gives valuable fragmentation cues in the form of mass-to-charge ratio peaks. However, the lack of experimental spectra hinders the attachment of each molecular identification, and thus urges the establishment of prediction approaches for computational models. Deep learning models appear promising for predicting molecular structure spectra, but overall assessment remains challenging as a result of the heterogeneity in methods and the lack of well-defined benchmarks. To address this, our contribution is the creation of benchmark framework FlexMS for constructing and evaluating diverse model architectures in mass spectrum prediction. With its easy-to-use flexibility, FlexMS supports the dynamic construction of numerous distinct combinations of model architectures, while assessing their performance on preprocessed public datasets using different metrics. In this paper, we provide insights into factors influencing performance, including the structural diversity of datasets, hyperparameters like learning rate and data sparsity, pretraining effects, metadata ablation settings and cross-domain transfer learning analysis. This provides practical guidance in choosing suitable models. Moreover, retrieval benchmarks simulate practical identification scenarios and score potential matches based on predicted spectra.

zh.title: FlexMS是一个用于基准测试代谢组学中基于深度学习的质谱预测工具的灵活框架
zh.summary: FlexMS提供了一个灵活的基准测试框架，用于评估药物发现和材料科学应用中质谱预测的深度学习模型。该框架能够系统地评估模型架构在不同数据集和指标上的表现，揭示数据多样性、超参数和迁移学习如何影响预测性能。

fr.title: FlexMS est un cadre flexible pour le benchmarking des outils de prédiction du spectre de masse basés sur l'apprentissage profond en métabolomique
fr.summary: FlexMS fournit un cadre de benchmarking flexible pour évaluer les modèles d'apprentissage profond dans la prédiction du spectre de masse pour les applications de découverte de médicaments et de science des matériaux. Le cadre permet une évaluation systématique des architectures de modèles sur des ensembles de données et des métriques divers, révélant comment la diversité des données, les hyperparamètres et l'apprentissage par transfert affectent les performances de prédiction.

de.title: FlexMS ist ein flexibles Framework für das Benchmarking von auf tiefem Lernen basierenden Massenspektrumvorhersage-Tools in der Metabolomik
de.summary: FlexMS bietet ein flexibles Benchmarking-Framework zur Bewertung von Deep-Learning-Modellen bei der Massenspektrumvorhersage für Anwendungen in der Wirkstoffforschung und Materialwissenschaften. Das Framework ermöglicht eine systematische Bewertung von Modellarchitekturen über vielfältige Datensätze und Metriken hinweg und zeigt, wie Datendiversität, Hyperparameter und Transfer Learning die Vorhersageleistung beeinflussen.

es.title: FlexMS es un marco flexible para el benchmarking de herramientas de predicción de espectros de masa basadas en aprendizaje profundo en metabolómica
es.summary: FlexMS proporciona un marco de benchmarking flexible para evaluar modelos de aprendizaje profundo en la predicción de espectros de masa para aplicaciones de descubrimiento de fármacos y ciencia de materiales. El marco permite la evaluación sistemática de arquitecturas de modelos en conjuntos de datos y métricas diversos, revelando cómo la diversidad de datos, los hiperparámetros y el aprendizaje de transferencia afectan el rendimiento de predicción.

title: DeepPresenter: Environment-Grounded Reflection for Agentic Presentation Generation
summary: DeepPresenter introduces an agentic framework for autonomous presentation generation that plans, renders, and iteratively refines slides through observation of actual rendered artifacts rather than relying on fixed templates. By reflecting on perceptual artifact states, the system identifies and corrects presentation-specific issues while adapting to diverse user needs.
content:
arXiv:2602.22839v1 Announce Type: new 
Abstract: Presentation generation requires deep content research, coherent visual design, and iterative refinement based on observation. However, existing presentation agents often rely on predefined workflows and fixed templates. To address this, we present DeepPresenter, an agentic framework that adapts to diverse user intents, enables effective feedback-driven refinement, and generalizes beyond a scripted pipeline. Specifically, DeepPresenter autonomously plans, renders, and revises intermediate slide artifacts to support long-horizon refinement with environmental observations. Furthermore, rather than relying on self-reflection over internal signals (e.g., reasoning traces), our environment-grounded reflection conditions the generation process on perceptual artifact states (e.g., rendered slides), enabling the system to identify and correct presentation-specific issues during execution. Results on the evaluation set covering diverse presentation-generation scenarios show that DeepPresenter achieves state-of-the-art performance, and the fine-tuned 9B model remains highly competitive at substantially lower cost. Our project is available at: https://github.com/icip-cas/PPTAgent

zh.title: DeepPresenter：环境感知反思用于智能演示生成
zh.summary: DeepPresenter引入了一个智能代理框架，用于自主演示生成，通过观察实际渲染的工件而不是依赖固定模板来规划、渲染和迭代改进幻灯片。通过反思感知工件状态，系统识别并纠正演示特定问题，同时适应多样化的用户需求。

fr.title: DeepPresenter : Réflexion ancrée dans l'environnement pour la génération de présentations par agent
fr.summary: DeepPresenter introduit un cadre d'agent pour la génération autonome de présentations qui planifie, rend et affine itérativement les diapositives en observant les artefacts réellement rendus plutôt que de s'appuyer sur des modèles fixes. En réfléchissant aux états des artefacts perceptuels, le système identifie et corrige les problèmes spécifiques aux présentations tout en s'adaptant aux besoins divers des utilisateurs.

de.title: DeepPresenter: Umgebungsgestützte Reflexion für agentenbasierte Präsentationsgenerierung
de.summary: DeepPresenter führt ein Agenten-Framework für autonome Präsentationsgenerierung ein, das Folien durch Beobachtung tatsächlich gerenderter Artefakte plant, rendert und iterativ verfeinert, anstatt sich auf feste Vorlagen zu verlassen. Durch Reflexion über Perzeptionszustände von Artefakten identifiziert und korrigiert das System präsentationsspezifische Probleme und passt sich gleichzeitig an unterschiedliche Benutzeranforderungen an.

es.title: DeepPresenter: Reflexión Orientada al Entorno para Generación de Presentaciones por Agentes
es.summary: DeepPresenter introduce un marco de agentes para la generación autónoma de presentaciones que planifica, renderiza y refina iterativamente diapositivas mediante la observación de artefactos realmente renderizados en lugar de depender de plantillas fijas. Al reflexionar sobre los estados de artefactos perceptuales, el sistema identifica y corrige problemas específicos de presentaciones mientras se adapta a las necesidades diversas de los usuarios.

title: The AI Research Assistant: Promise, Peril, and a Proof of Concept
summary: Through detailed case study of human-AI collaboration in mathematical research, researchers demonstrate that AI significantly accelerates theorem discovery when paired with rigorous human verification and expert guidance. The work reveals both remarkable AI capabilities in algebraic manipulation and critical limitations that demand constant human oversight and deep domain expertise.
content:
arXiv:2602.22842v1 Announce Type: new 
Abstract: Can artificial intelligence truly contribute to creative mathematical research, or does it merely automate routine calculations while introducing risks of error? We provide empirical evidence through a detailed case study: the discovery of novel error representations and bounds for Hermite quadrature rules via systematic human-AI collaboration.
  Working with multiple AI assistants, we extended results beyond what manual work achieved, formulating and proving several theorems with AI assistance. The collaboration revealed both remarkable capabilities and critical limitations. AI excelled at algebraic manipulation, systematic proof exploration, literature synthesis, and LaTeX preparation. However, every step required rigorous human verification, mathematical intuition for problem formulation, and strategic direction.
  We document the complete research workflow with unusual transparency, revealing patterns in successful human-AI mathematical collaboration and identifying failure modes researchers must anticipate. Our experience suggests that, when used with appropriate skepticism and verification protocols, AI tools can meaningfully accelerate mathematical discovery while demanding careful human oversight and deep domain expertise.

zh.title: AI研究助手：承诺、风险与概念验证
zh.summary: 通过对人工智能与人类在数学研究中协作的详细案例研究，研究人员证明了当AI与严格的人类验证和专家指导相结合时，AI能够显著加速定理发现。这项工作揭示了AI在代数操作方面的卓越能力，以及需要持续人类监督和深厚领域专业知识的关键局限性。

fr.title: L'Assistant de Recherche par IA : Promesses, Dangers et Preuve de Concept
fr.summary: Par une étude de cas détaillée de la collaboration humain-IA dans la recherche mathématique, les chercheurs démontrent que l'IA accélère considérablement la découverte de théorèmes lorsqu'elle est associée à une vérification humaine rigoureuse et à des conseils d'experts. Le travail révèle à la fois les capacités remarquables de l'IA en manipulation algébrique et les limitations critiques qui exigent une supervision humaine constante et une expertise métier approfondie.

de.title: Der KI-Forschungsassistent: Versprechen, Gefahren und Machbarkeitsstudie
de.summary: Durch eine detaillierte Fallstudie der Mensch-KI-Zusammenarbeit in der mathematischen Forschung zeigen Forscher, dass KI die Theoremfindung erheblich beschleunigt, wenn sie mit rigoroser menschlicher Verifikation und fachlicher Anleitung kombiniert wird. Die Arbeit offenbart sowohl bemerkenswerte KI-Fähigkeiten in der algebraischen Manipulation als auch kritische Einschränkungen, die konstante menschliche Aufsicht und tiefe Fachkompetenz erfordern.

es.title: El Asistente de Investigación por IA: Promesas, Peligros y Prueba de Concepto
es.summary: A través de un estudio de caso detallado de la colaboración humano-IA en investigación matemática, los investigadores demuestran que la IA acelera significativamente el descubrimiento de teoremas cuando se combina con una rigurosa verificación humana y orientación de expertos. El trabajo revela tanto las notables capacidades de la IA en manipulación algebraica como las limitaciones críticas que exigen supervisión humana constante y experiencia profunda en el dominio.

title: Towards LLM-Empowered Knowledge Tracing via LLM-Student Hierarchical Behavior Alignment in Hyperbolic Space
summary: L-HAKT applies large language models and hyperbolic geometry to knowledge tracing in education by explicitly modeling hierarchical learning concept structures and aligning synthetic with real student behaviors. The framework better captures students' individualized problem difficulty perception and learning progression patterns.
content:
arXiv:2602.22879v1 Announce Type: new 
Abstract: Knowledge Tracing (KT) diagnoses students' concept mastery through continuous learning state monitoring in education.Existing methods primarily focus on studying behavioral sequences based on ID or textual information.While existing methods rely on ID-based sequences or shallow textual features, they often fail to capture (1) the hierarchical evolution of cognitive states and (2) individualized problem difficulty perception due to limited semantic modeling. Therefore, this paper proposes a Large Language Model Hyperbolic Aligned Knowledge Tracing(L-HAKT). First, the teacher agent deeply parses question semantics and explicitly constructs hierarchical dependencies of knowledge points; the student agent simulates learning behaviors to generate synthetic data. Then, contrastive learning is performed between synthetic and real data in hyperbolic space to reduce distribution differences in key features such as question difficulty and forgetting patterns. Finally, by optimizing hyperbolic curvature, we explicitly model the tree-like hierarchical structure of knowledge points, precisely characterizing differences in learning curve morphology for knowledge points at different levels. Extensive experiments on four real-world educational datasets validate the effectiveness of our Large Language Model Hyperbolic Aligned Knowledge Tracing (L-HAKT) framework.

zh.title: 通过双曲空间中的LLM-学生层次行为对齐实现LLM赋能的知识追踪
zh.summary: L-HAKT通过应用大型语言模型和双曲几何来进行教育中的知识追踪，显式地建模分层学习概念结构，并将合成学生行为与真实学生行为对齐。该框架更好地捕捉了学生对问题难度的个性化感知和学习进度模式。

fr.title: Vers un Suivi des Connaissances Renforcé par LLM via l'Alignement des Comportements Hiérarchiques LLM-Étudiant dans l'Espace Hyperbolique
fr.summary: L-HAKT applique les grands modèles de langage et la géométrie hyperbolique au suivi des connaissances en éducation en modélisant explicitement les structures hiérarchiques des concepts d'apprentissage et en alignant les comportements des étudiants synthétiques avec ceux des étudiants réels. Le cadre capture mieux la perception individualisée de la difficulté des problèmes par les étudiants et les modèles de progression d'apprentissage.

de.title: Hin zu LLM-gestütztem Wissens-Tracing durch hierarchische LLM-Student-Verhaltensausrichtung im hyperbolischen Raum
de.summary: L-HAKT wendet große Sprachmodelle und hyperbolische Geometrie auf das Wissens-Tracing in der Bildung an, indem es hierarchische Strukturen von Lernkonzepten explizit modelliert und synthetische Studentenverhalten an echte Studentenverhalten abstimmt. Das Framework erfasst besser die individualisierte Wahrnehmung der Problemschwierigkeit durch Schüler und Lernfortschrittsmuster.

es.title: Hacia el Rastreo de Conocimiento Potenciado por LLM mediante Alineación de Comportamiento Jerárquico LLM-Estudiante en el Espacio Hiperbólico
es.summary: L-HAKT aplica modelos de lenguaje grande y geometría hiperbólica al rastreo de conocimiento en educación modelando explícitamente estructuras jerárquicas de conceptos de aprendizaje y alineando comportamientos de estudiantes sintéticos con estudiantes reales. El marco captura mejor la percepción individualizada de la dificultad de los problemas por parte de los estudiantes y los patrones de progresión del aprendizaje.

title: OmniGAIA: Towards Native Omni-Modal AI Agents
summary: OmniGAIA introduces both a benchmark and foundational framework for evaluating and training AI agents that simultaneously reason across video, audio, and image modalities with integrated tool use. Unlike existing bi-modal systems, it tests true cross-modal reasoning on complex real-world tasks requiring deep multimodal analysis.
content:
arXiv:2602.22897v1 Announce Type: new 
Abstract: Human intelligence naturally intertwines omni-modal perception -- spanning vision, audio, and language -- with complex reasoning and tool usage to interact with the world. However, current multi-modal LLMs are primarily confined to bi-modal interactions (e.g., vision-language), lacking the unified cognitive capabilities required for general AI assistants. To bridge this gap, we introduce OmniGAIA, a comprehensive benchmark designed to evaluate omni-modal agents on tasks necessitating deep reasoning and multi-turn tool execution across video, audio, and image modalities. Constructed via a novel omni-modal event graph approach, OmniGAIA synthesizes complex, multi-hop queries derived from real-world data that require cross-modal reasoning and external tool integration. Furthermore, we propose OmniAtlas, a native omni-modal foundation agent under tool-integrated reasoning paradigm with active omni-modal perception. Trained on trajectories synthesized via a hindsight-guided tree exploration strategy and OmniDPO for fine-grained error correction, OmniAtlas effectively enhances the tool-use capabilities of existing open-source models. This work marks a step towards next-generation native omni-modal AI assistants for real-world scenarios.

zh.title: OmniGAIA：迈向原生全模态AI代理
zh.summary: OmniGAIA引入了一个基准和基础框架，用于评估和训练能同时在视频、音频和图像模态上进行推理且具有集成工具使用的AI代理。与现有的双模态系统不同，它在复杂的现实任务上测试真正的跨模态推理，需要深度多模态分析。

fr.title: OmniGAIA : Vers des Agents IA Omni-Modaux Natifs
fr.summary: OmniGAIA introduit un benchmark et un cadre fondamental pour évaluer et entraîner des agents IA qui raisonnent simultanément sur les modalités vidéo, audio et image avec une utilisation d'outils intégrée. Contrairement aux systèmes bi-modaux existants, il teste un vrai raisonnement multimodal sur des tâches complexes du monde réel nécessitant une analyse multimodale approfondie.

de.title: OmniGAIA: Zu nativen omni-modalen KI-Agenten
de.summary: OmniGAIA führt sowohl einen Benchmark als auch ein grundlegendes Framework zur Bewertung und zum Training von KI-Agenten ein, die gleichzeitig über Video-, Audio- und Bildmodalitäten mit integrierter Werkzeugnutzung argumentieren. Im Gegensatz zu bestehenden bi-modalen Systemen testet es echtes multimodales Denken bei komplexen realen Aufgaben, die tiefe multimodale Analyse erfordern.

es.title: OmniGAIA: Hacia Agentes IA Omni-Modales Nativos
es.summary: OmniGAIA introduce tanto un benchmark como un marco fundamental para evaluar y entrenar agentes de IA que razonan simultáneamente en modalidades de video, audio e imagen con uso integrado de herramientas. A diferencia de los sistemas bi-modales existentes, prueba el verdadero razonamiento multimodal en tareas complejas del mundo real que requieren análisis multimodal profundo.

title: General Agent Evaluation
summary: This paper establishes systematic evaluation frameworks for general-purpose agents that work in unfamiliar environments without domain-specific customization, revealing they match specialized systems' performance without environment-specific tuning. The Open General Agent Leaderboard provides standardized benchmarks for comparing agent generalization across diverse environments.
content:
arXiv:2602.22953v1 Announce Type: new 
Abstract: The promise of general-purpose agents - systems that perform tasks in unfamiliar environments without domain-specific engineering - remains largely unrealized. Existing agents are predominantly specialized, and while emerging implementations like OpenAI SDK Agent and Claude Code hint at broader capabilities, no systematic evaluation of their general performance has been pursued. Current agentic benchmarks assume domain-specific integration, encoding task information in ways that preclude fair evaluation of general agents. This paper frames general-agent evaluation as a first-class research objective. We propose conceptual principles for such evaluation, a Unified Protocol enabling agent-benchmark integration, and Exgentic - a practical framework for general agent evaluation. We benchmark five prominent agent implementations across six environments as the first Open General Agent Leaderboard. Our experiments show that general agents generalize across diverse environments, achieving performance comparable to domain-specific agents without any environment-specific tuning. We release our evaluation protocol, framework, and leaderboard to establish a foundation for systematic research on general-purpose agents.

zh.title: 通用智能体评估
zh.summary: 本文为在不熟悉的环境中工作且无需特定领域定制的通用目的智能体建立了系统的评估框架，揭示它们在没有特定环境调优的情况下与专门系统的性能相匹配。开放通用智能体排行榜为比较不同环境中的智能体泛化提供了标准化基准。

fr.title: Évaluation des Agents Généraux
fr.summary: Cet article établit des cadres d'évaluation systématiques pour les agents polyvalents qui fonctionnent dans des environnements inconnus sans personnalisation spécifique au domaine, révélant qu'ils correspondent aux performances des systèmes spécialisés sans tuning spécifique à l'environnement. Le classement ouvert des agents généraux fournit des benchmarks normalisés pour comparer la généralisation des agents dans des environnements diversifiés.

de.title: Bewertung allgemeiner Agenten
de.summary: Dieses Papier etabliert systematische Bewertungsrahmen für allgemeine Agenten, die in unbekannten Umgebungen ohne domänenspezifische Anpassung funktionieren, und zeigt, dass sie die Leistung spezialisierter Systeme ohne umgebungsspezifische Abstimmung erreichen. Das Open General Agent Leaderboard bietet standardisierte Benchmarks zum Vergleichen der Agentengeneralisierung in verschiedenen Umgebungen.

es.title: Evaluación de Agentes Generales
es.summary: Este artículo establece marcos de evaluación sistemáticos para agentes de propósito general que funcionan en entornos desconocidos sin personalización específica del dominio, revelando que coinciden con el rendimiento de sistemas especializados sin ajuste específico del entorno. La tabla de clasificación abierta de agentes generales proporciona puntos de referencia estandarizados para comparar la generalización de agentes en diversos entornos.

title: FactGuard: Agentic Video Misinformation Detection via Reinforcement Learning
summary: FactGuard addresses limitations in video misinformation detection by formulating verification as iterative reasoning where agents assess task ambiguity and selectively invoke external verification tools. Reinforcement learning training optimizes both tool usage patterns and risk-sensitive decision-making for robust misinformation detection.
content:
arXiv:2602.22963v1 Announce Type: new 
Abstract: Multimodal large language models (MLLMs) have substantially advanced video misinformation detection through unified multimodal reasoning, but they often rely on fixed-depth inference and place excessive trust in internally generated assumptions, particularly in scenarios where critical evidence is sparse, fragmented, or requires external verification. To address these limitations, we propose FactGuard, an agentic framework for video misinformation detection that formulates verification as an iterative reasoning process built upon MLLMs. FactGuard explicitly assesses task ambiguity and selectively invokes external tools to acquire critical evidence, enabling progressive refinement of reasoning trajectories. To further strengthen this capability, we introduce a two-stage training strategy that combines domain-specific agentic supervised fine-tuning with decision-aware reinforcement learning to optimize tool usage and calibrate risk-sensitive decision making. Extensive experiments on FakeSV, FakeTT, and FakeVV demonstrate FactGuard's state-of-the-art performance and validate its excellent robustness and generalization capacity.

zh.title: FactGuard：通过强化学习的智能体视频虚假信息检测
zh.summary: FactGuard通过将验证表述为迭代推理来解决视频虚假信息检测中的局限性，其中智能体评估任务的模糊性并有选择地调用外部验证工具。强化学习训练优化了工具使用模式和风险敏感决策，以实现稳健的虚假信息检测。

fr.title: FactGuard : Détection de Désinformation Vidéo par Agents via Apprentissage par Renforcement
fr.summary: FactGuard résout les limitations de la détection de désinformation vidéo en formulant la vérification comme un raisonnement itératif où les agents évaluent l'ambiguïté des tâches et invoquent sélectivement des outils de vérification externes. L'entraînement par apprentissage par renforcement optimise à la fois les modèles d'utilisation d'outils et la prise de décision sensible au risque pour une détection robuste de la désinformation.

de.title: FactGuard: Agentische Erkennung von Videomisinformation durch Reinforcement Learning
de.summary: FactGuard adressiert Einschränkungen in der Erkennung von Videomisinformation, indem Verifikation als iteratives Denken formuliert wird, wobei Agenten Aufgabenambiguität bewerten und selektiv externe Verifikationswerkzeuge aufrufen. Das Reinforcement-Learning-Training optimiert sowohl Werkzeugnutzungsmuster als auch risikosensitive Entscheidungsfindung für robuste Misinformationserkennung.

es.title: FactGuard: Detección de Desinformación de Video mediante Agentes por Aprendizaje Reforzado
es.summary: FactGuard aborda las limitaciones en la detección de desinformación de video formulando la verificación como razonamiento iterativo donde los agentes evalúan la ambigüedad de la tarea e invocan selectivamente herramientas de verificación externas. El entrenamiento de aprendizaje reforzado optimiza tanto los patrones de uso de herramientas como la toma de decisiones sensible al riesgo para una detección robusta de desinformación.

title: Certified Circuits: Stability Guarantees for Mechanistic Circuits
summary: Researchers introduce Certified Circuits, a framework that provides provable stability guarantees for neural network circuit discovery by wrapping existing algorithms with randomized data subsampling. The method produces more compact and accurate circuits while ensuring their inclusion decisions remain stable across perturbations of the concept dataset.
content:
arXiv:2602.22968v1 Announce Type: new 
Abstract: Understanding how neural networks arrive at their predictions is essential for debugging, auditing, and deployment. Mechanistic interpretability pursues this goal by identifying circuits - minimal subnetworks responsible for specific behaviors. However, existing circuit discovery methods are brittle: circuits depend strongly on the chosen concept dataset and often fail to transfer out-of-distribution, raising doubts whether they capture concept or dataset-specific artifacts. We introduce Certified Circuits, which provide provable stability guarantees for circuit discovery. Our framework wraps any black-box discovery algorithm with randomized data subsampling to certify that circuit component inclusion decisions are invariant to bounded edit-distance perturbations of the concept dataset. Unstable neurons are abstained from, yielding circuits that are more compact and more accurate. On ImageNet and OOD datasets, certified circuits achieve up to 91% higher accuracy while using 45% fewer neurons, and remain reliable where baselines degrade. Certified Circuits puts circuit discovery on formal ground by producing mechanistic explanations that are provably stable and better aligned with the target concept. Code will be released soon!

zh.title: 认证电路：机械电路的稳定性保证
zh.summary: 研究人员推出了认证电路，这是一个为神经网络电路发现提供可验证稳定性保证的框架，通过用随机数据子采样包装现有算法实现。该方法生成更紧凑和准确的电路，同时确保其包含决策在概念数据集的扰动中保持稳定。

fr.title: Circuits Certifiés : Garanties de Stabilité pour les Circuits Mécanistiques
fr.summary: Les chercheurs introduisent les Circuits Certifiés, un cadre qui fournit des garanties de stabilité prouvables pour la découverte de circuits de réseaux de neurones en enveloppant les algorithmes existants avec un sous-échantillonnage de données aléatoires. La méthode produit des circuits plus compacts et plus précis tout en assurant que leurs décisions d'inclusion restent stables à travers les perturbations de l'ensemble de données conceptuelles.

de.title: Zertifizierte Schaltkreise: Stabilitätsgarantien für mechanistische Schaltkreise
de.summary: Forscher führen Zertifizierte Schaltkreise ein, ein Framework, das nachweisbare Stabilitätsgarantien für die Entdeckung von neuronalen Netzwerk-Schaltkreisen bietet, indem bestehende Algorithmen mit randomisierter Daten-Subsampling umhüllt werden. Die Methode erzeugt kompaktere und genauere Schaltkreise und stellt sicher, dass ihre Einschlussentscheidungen über Störungen des Konzeptdatensatzes hinweg stabil bleiben.

es.title: Circuitos Certificados: Garantías de Estabilidad para Circuitos Mecanísticos
es.summary: Los investigadores presentan Circuitos Certificados, un marco que proporciona garantías de estabilidad comprobables para el descubrimiento de circuitos de redes neuronales al envolver algoritmos existentes con submuestreo de datos aleatorizado. El método produce circuitos más compactos y precisos mientras asegura que sus decisiones de inclusión permanezcan estables en las perturbaciones del conjunto de datos conceptuales.

title: SPM-Bench: Benchmarking Large Language Models for Scanning Probe Microscopy
summary: Researchers present SPM-Bench, a PhD-level benchmark for evaluating LLMs on scanning probe microscopy tasks using an automated data synthesis pipeline. The benchmark introduces the Strict Imperfection Penalty F1 score to evaluate model performance and reveals distinct AI "personalities" in complex scientific reasoning tasks.
content:
arXiv:2602.22971v1 Announce Type: new 
Abstract: As LLMs achieved breakthroughs in general reasoning, their proficiency in specialized scientific domains reveals pronounced gaps in existing benchmarks due to data contamination, insufficient complexity, and prohibitive human labor costs. Here we present SPM-Bench, an original, PhD-level multimodal benchmark specifically designed for scanning probe microscopy (SPM). We propose a fully automated data synthesis pipeline that ensures both high authority and low-cost. By employing Anchor-Gated Sieve (AGS) technology, we efficiently extract high-value image-text pairs from arXiv and journal papers published between 2023 and 2025. Through a hybrid cloud-local architecture where VLMs return only spatial coordinates "llbox" for local high-fidelity cropping, our pipeline achieves extreme token savings while maintaining high dataset purity. To accurately and objectively evaluate the performance of the LLMs, we introduce the Strict Imperfection Penalty F1 (SIP-F1) score. This metric not only establishes a rigorous capability hierarchy but also, for the first time, quantifies model "personalities" (Conservative, Aggressive, Gambler, or Wise). By correlating these results with model-reported confidence and perceived difficulty, we expose the true reasoning boundaries of current AI in complex physical scenarios. These insights establish SPM-Bench as a generalizable paradigm for automated scientific data synthesis.

zh.title: SPM-Bench：大型语言模型在扫描探针显微镜中的基准测试
zh.summary: 研究人员提出了SPM-Bench，一个博士级基准测试，用于评估大型语言模型在扫描探针显微镜任务上的性能，使用自动数据合成管道。该基准测试引入了严格缺陷惩罚F1分数来评估模型性能，并揭示了复杂科学推理任务中不同的人工智能"个性"。

fr.title: SPM-Bench : Évaluation des Grands Modèles de Langage pour la Microscopie à Sonde Balayante
fr.summary: Les chercheurs présentent SPM-Bench, un benchmark de niveau doctorat pour évaluer les LLMs sur les tâches de microscopie à sonde balayante en utilisant un pipeline de synthèse de données automatisé. Le benchmark introduit le score F1 de Pénalité d'Imperfection Stricte pour évaluer les performances du modèle et révèle des "personnalités" d'IA distinctes dans les tâches complexes de raisonnement scientifique.

de.title: SPM-Bench: Benchmarking großer Sprachmodelle für Rasterkraftmikroskopie
de.summary: Forscher präsentieren SPM-Bench, eine Benchmark auf Doktorandenniveau zur Bewertung von LLMs bei Rasterkraftmikroskopie-Aufgaben unter Verwendung einer automatisierten Datensynthese-Pipeline. Die Benchmark führt die Strict Imperfection Penalty F1-Score ein, um die Modellleistung zu bewerten, und offenbart unterschiedliche KI-"Persönlichkeiten" bei komplexen wissenschaftlichen Denkaufgaben.

es.title: SPM-Bench: Evaluación de Grandes Modelos de Lenguaje para Microscopía de Sonda de Barrido
es.summary: Los investigadores presentan SPM-Bench, un punto de referencia a nivel de doctorado para evaluar LLMs en tareas de microscopía de sonda de barrido utilizando una tubería de síntesis de datos automatizada. El punto de referencia introduce la puntuación F1 de Penalización de Imperfección Estricta para evaluar el desempeño del modelo y revela "personalidades" de IA distintas en tareas complejas de razonamiento científico.

title: Modeling Expert AI Diagnostic Alignment via Immutable Inference Snapshots
summary: Researchers present a framework that preserves AI-generated medical reports as immutable snapshots and compares them with physician-validated outcomes to measure alignment in clinical AI systems. Testing on dermatological cases showed 71.4% exact agreement and 100% comprehensive concordance, indicating that binary evaluation significantly underestimates clinically meaningful alignment.
content:
arXiv:2602.22973v1 Announce Type: new 
Abstract: Human-in-the-loop validation is essential in safety-critical clinical AI, yet the transition between initial model inference and expert correction is rarely analyzed as a structured signal. We introduce a diagnostic alignment framework in which the AI-generated image based report is preserved as an immutable inference state and systematically compared with the physician-validated outcome. The inference pipeline integrates a vision-enabled large language model, BERT- based medical entity extraction, and a Sequential Language Model Inference (SLMI) step to enforce domain-consistent refinement prior to expert review. Evaluation on 21 dermatological cases (21 complete AI physician pairs) em- ployed a four-level concordance framework comprising exact primary match rate (PMR), semantic similarity-adjusted rate (AMR), cross-category alignment, and Comprehensive Concordance Rate (CCR). Exact agreement reached 71.4% and remained unchanged under semantic similarity (t = 0.60), while structured cross-category and differential overlap analysis yielded 100% comprehensive concordance (95% CI: [83.9%, 100%]). No cases demonstrated complete diagnostic divergence. These findings show that binary lexical evaluation substantially un- derestimates clinically meaningful alignment. Modeling expert validation as a structured transformation enables signal-aware quantification of correction dynamics and supports traceable, human aligned evaluation of image based clinical decision support systems.

zh.title: 通过不可变推理快照建模专家AI诊断对齐
zh.summary: 研究人员提出了一个框架，将AI生成的医学报告保存为不可变快照，并与医生验证的结果进行比较，以衡量临床AI系统的对齐情况。在皮肤病学病例的测试中显示了71.4%的完全一致和100%的全面一致，表明二元评估显著低估了临床上有意义的对齐。

fr.title: Modélisation de l'alignement des diagnostics IA d'experts via des instantanés d'inférence immuables
fr.summary: Les chercheurs présentent un cadre qui préserve les rapports médicaux générés par l'IA en tant qu'instantanés immuables et les compare aux résultats validés par les médecins pour mesurer l'alignement dans les systèmes d'IA cliniques. Les tests sur des cas dermatologiques ont montré 71,4% d'accord exact et 100% de concordance complète, indiquant que l'évaluation binaire sous-estime considérablement l'alignement cliniquement significatif.

de.title: Modellierung der Ausrichtung von Experten-KI-Diagnosen durch unveränderliche Inferenz-Snapshots
de.summary: Forscher präsentieren ein Framework, das KI-generierte medizinische Berichte als unveränderliche Snapshots speichert und sie mit ärztlich validierten Ergebnissen vergleicht, um die Ausrichtung in klinischen KI-Systemen zu messen. Tests an dermatologischen Fällen zeigten 71,4% genaue Übereinstimmung und 100% umfassende Übereinstimmung, was darauf hindeutet, dass die binäre Bewertung die klinisch signifikante Ausrichtung erheblich unterschätzt.

es.title: Modelado de la alineación diagnóstica de IA experta mediante instantáneas de inferencia inmutable
es.summary: Los investigadores presentan un marco que preserva los informes médicos generados por IA como instantáneas inmutables y los compara con resultados validados por médicos para medir la alineación en sistemas de IA clínica. Las pruebas en casos dermatológicos mostraron un 71,4% de concordancia exacta y un 100% de concordancia integral, lo que indica que la evaluación binaria subestima significativamente la alineación clínicamente significativa.

title: RepSPD: Enhancing SPD Manifold Representation in EEGs via Dynamic Graphs
summary: Researchers propose RepSPD, a geometric deep learning model that uses cross-attention mechanisms on Riemannian manifolds to improve EEG representation learning. The approach incorporates graph-derived functional connectivity features and bidirectional alignment strategies to enhance the analysis of brain activity from electroencephalography data.
content:
arXiv:2602.22981v1 Announce Type: new 
Abstract: Decoding brain activity from electroencephalography (EEG) is crucial for neuroscience and clinical applications. Among recent advances in deep learning for EEG, geometric learning stands out as its theoretical underpinnings on symmetric positive definite (SPD) allows revealing structural connectivity analysis in a physics-grounded manner. However, current SPD-based methods focus predominantly on statistical aggregation of EEGs, with frequency-specific synchronization and local topological structures of brain regions neglected. Given this, we propose RepSPD, a novel geometric deep learning (GDL)-based model. RepSPD implements a cross-attention mechanism on the Riemannian manifold to modulate the geometric attributes of SPD with graph-derived functional connectivity features. On top of this, we introduce a global bidirectional alignment strategy to reshape tangent-space embeddings, mitigating geometric distortions caused by curvature and thereby enhancing geometric consistency. Extensive experiments demonstrate that our proposed framework significantly outperforms existing EEG representation methods, exhibiting superior robustness and generalization capabilities.

zh.title: RepSPD: 通过动态图增强脑电图中的SPD流形表示
zh.summary: 研究人员提出了RepSPD，一个几何深度学习模型，使用黎曼流形上的交叉注意力机制来改进脑电图表示学习。该方法结合了图导出的功能连接特征和双向对齐策略，以增强脑电图数据的脑活动分析。

fr.title: RepSPD: Amélioration de la représentation des variétés SPD dans les EEG via des graphes dynamiques
fr.summary: Les chercheurs proposent RepSPD, un modèle d'apprentissage profond géométrique qui utilise des mécanismes d'attention croisée sur les variétés riemanniennes pour améliorer l'apprentissage de la représentation EEG. L'approche intègre des caractéristiques de connectivité fonctionnelle dérivées du graphe et des stratégies d'alignement bidirectionnel pour améliorer l'analyse de l'activité cérébrale à partir des données d'électroencéphalographie.

de.title: RepSPD: Verbesserung der SPD-Mannigfaltigkeitsdarstellung in EEGs durch dynamische Graphen
de.summary: Forscher schlagen RepSPD vor, ein geometrisches Deep-Learning-Modell, das Kreuzaufmerksamkeitsmechanismen auf Riemannian-Mannigfaltigkeiten nutzt, um das EEG-Darstellungslernen zu verbessern. Der Ansatz integriert graphabgeleitete funktionelle Konnektivitätsmerkmale und bidirektionale Ausrichtungsstrategien, um die Analyse der Gehirnaktivität aus Elektroenzephalographiedaten zu verbessern.

es.title: RepSPD: Mejora de la representación de variedades SPD en EEGs mediante gráficos dinámicos
es.summary: Los investigadores proponen RepSPD, un modelo de aprendizaje profundo geométrico que utiliza mecanismos de atención cruzada en variedades riemannianas para mejorar el aprendizaje de la representación de EEG. El enfoque incorpora características de conectividad funcional derivadas de gráficos y estrategias de alineación bidireccional para mejorar el análisis de la actividad cerebral a partir de datos de electroencefalografía.

title: Obscure but Effective: Classical Chinese Jailbreak Prompt Optimization via Bio-Inspired Search
summary: Researchers investigate how classical Chinese can partially bypass LLM safety constraints due to its conciseness and obscurity, and develop CC-BOS, a framework for automatically generating classical Chinese adversarial prompts using fruit fly optimization. The study demonstrates the effectiveness of the approach while exposing vulnerabilities in current LLM safety mechanisms.
content:
arXiv:2602.22983v1 Announce Type: new 
Abstract: As Large Language Models (LLMs) are increasingly used, their security risks have drawn increasing attention. Existing research reveals that LLMs are highly susceptible to jailbreak attacks, with effectiveness varying across language contexts. This paper investigates the role of classical Chinese in jailbreak attacks. Owing to its conciseness and obscurity, classical Chinese can partially bypass existing safety constraints, exposing notable vulnerabilities in LLMs. Based on this observation, this paper proposes a framework, CC-BOS, for the automatic generation of classical Chinese adversarial prompts based on multi-dimensional fruit fly optimization, facilitating efficient and automated jailbreak attacks in black-box settings. Prompts are encoded into eight policy dimensions-covering role, behavior, mechanism, metaphor, expression, knowledge, trigger pattern and context; and iteratively refined via smell search, visual search, and cauchy mutation. This design enables efficient exploration of the search space, thereby enhancing the effectiveness of black-box jailbreak attacks. To enhance readability and evaluation accuracy, we further design a classical Chinese to English translation module. Extensive experiments demonstrate that effectiveness of the proposed CC-BOS, consistently outperforming state-of-the-art jailbreak attack methods.

zh.title: 晦涩但有效: 通过生物启发搜索进行古文越狱提示优化
zh.summary: 研究人员调查了古汉语如何因其简洁性和晦涩性而部分绕过大语言模型安全约束，并开发了CC-BOS框架，用于使用果蝇优化自动生成古文对抗提示。该研究展示了该方法的有效性，同时暴露了当前大语言模型安全机制中的漏洞。

fr.title: Obscur mais efficace: Optimisation des invites de jailbreak en chinois classique via la recherche bio-inspirée
fr.summary: Les chercheurs enquêtent sur la manière dont le chinois classique peut partiellement contourner les contraintes de sécurité des LLM en raison de sa concision et de son obscurité, et développent CC-BOS, un cadre pour générer automatiquement des invites adversariales en chinois classique en utilisant l'optimisation par essaim de fruits. L'étude démontre l'efficacité de l'approche tout en exposant les vulnérabilités des mécanismes de sécurité actuels des LLM.

de.title: Dunkel aber wirksam: Optimierung von Jailbreak-Prompts im klassischen Chinesischen durch bio-inspirierte Suche
de.summary: Forscher untersuchen, wie das klassische Chinesisch aufgrund seiner Prägnanz und Dunkelheit LLM-Sicherheitsbeschränkungen teilweise umgehen kann, und entwickeln CC-BOS, ein Framework zur automatischen Generierung von klassischen chinesischen gegnerischen Prompts mit Fruchtfliegen-Optimierung. Die Studie zeigt die Wirksamkeit des Ansatzes und legt gleichzeitig Schwachstellen in den aktuellen LLM-Sicherheitsmechanismen offen.

es.title: Oscuro pero efectivo: Optimización de indicadores de jailbreak en chino clásico mediante búsqueda bio-inspirada
es.summary: Los investigadores investigan cómo el chino clásico puede eludir parcialmente las restricciones de seguridad de los LLM debido a su concisión y oscuridad, y desarrollan CC-BOS, un marco para generar automáticamente indicaciones adversariales en chino clásico utilizando optimización de moscas de la fruta. El estudio demuestra la efectividad del enfoque al tiempo que expone vulnerabilidades en los mecanismos de seguridad actuales de los LLM.

title: Learning-based Multi-agent Race Strategies in Formula 1
summary: Researchers propose a reinforcement learning approach for optimizing Formula 1 race strategies by training agents to balance energy management, tire degradation, and pit-stop decisions while considering competitors' actions. The framework generates competitive policies that adapt pit timing, tire selection, and energy allocation in response to opponents.
content:
arXiv:2602.23056v1 Announce Type: new 
Abstract: In Formula 1, race strategies are adapted according to evolving race conditions and competitors' actions. This paper proposes a reinforcement learning approach for multi-agent race strategy optimization. Agents learn to balance energy management, tire degradation, aerodynamic interaction, and pit-stop decisions. Building on a pre-trained single-agent policy, we introduce an interaction module that accounts for the behavior of competitors. The combination of the interaction module and a self-play training scheme generates competitive policies, and agents are ranked based on their relative performance. Results show that the agents adapt pit timing, tire selection, and energy allocation in response to opponents, achieving robust and consistent race performance. Because the framework relies only on information available during real races, it can support race strategists' decisions before and during races.

zh.title: 学习型多智能体一级方程式赛车策略
zh.summary: 研究人员提出了一种强化学习方法，通过训练智能体来平衡能量管理、轮胎退化和进站决策，同时考虑对手的行动，从而优化一级方程式赛车策略。该框架生成竞争性策略，能够根据对手的反应调整进站时机、轮胎选择和能量分配。

fr.title: Stratégies de course multi-agents basées sur l'apprentissage en Formule 1
fr.summary: Les chercheurs proposent une approche d'apprentissage par renforcement pour optimiser les stratégies de course en Formule 1 en entraînant des agents à équilibrer la gestion de l'énergie, la dégradation des pneus et les décisions d'arrêt aux stands tout en tenant compte des actions des concurrents. Le cadre génère des stratégies compétitives qui adaptent le moment des arrêts, la sélection des pneus et l'allocation d'énergie en fonction des adversaires.

de.title: Lernbasierte Multi-Agent-Rennstrategien in der Formel 1
de.summary: Forscher schlagen einen Verstärkungslernansatz vor, um Formel-1-Rennstrategien durch Training von Agenten zu optimieren, die Energieverwaltung, Reifenverschleiß und Boxenstoppentscheidungen ausgleichen und gleichzeitig die Aktionen von Konkurrenten berücksichtigen. Der Rahmen generiert Wettbewerbsrichtlinien, die Boxenstopp-Timing, Reifenauswahl und Energieverteilung als Reaktion auf Gegner anpassen.

es.title: Estrategias de carrera multiagente basadas en aprendizaje en la Fórmula 1
es.summary: Los investigadores proponen un enfoque de aprendizaje por refuerzo para optimizar estrategias de carrera en la Fórmula 1 entrenando agentes para equilibrar la gestión de energía, la degradación de llantas y decisiones de paradas en boxes mientras consideran las acciones de los competidores. El marco genera políticas competitivas que adaptan el tiempo de parada, la selección de llantas y la asignación de energía en respuesta a los oponentes.

title: Enhancing CVRP Solver through LLM-driven Automatic Heuristic Design
summary: Researchers present AILS-AHD, a novel approach that leverages Large Language Models to automatically generate and optimize routing heuristics for the Capacitated Vehicle Routing Problem. The method achieved new best-known solutions on 8 out of 10 large-scale benchmark instances, demonstrating the effectiveness of LLM-driven heuristic design.
content:
arXiv:2602.23092v1 Announce Type: new 
Abstract: The Capacitated Vehicle Routing Problem (CVRP), a fundamental combinatorial optimization challenge, focuses on optimizing fleet operations under vehicle capacity constraints. While extensively studied in operational research, the NP-hard nature of CVRP continues to pose significant computational challenges, particularly for large-scale instances. This study presents AILS-AHD (Adaptive Iterated Local Search with Automatic Heuristic Design), a novel approach that leverages Large Language Models (LLMs) to revolutionize CVRP solving. Our methodology integrates an evolutionary search framework with LLMs to dynamically generate and optimize ruin heuristics within the AILS method. Additionally, we introduce an LLM-based acceleration mechanism to enhance computational efficiency. Comprehensive experimental evaluations against state-of-the-art solvers, including AILS-II and HGS, demonstrate the superior performance of AILS-AHD across both moderate and large-scale instances. Notably, our approach establishes new best-known solutions for 8 out of 10 instances in the CVRPLib large-scale benchmark, underscoring the potential of LLM-driven heuristic design in advancing the field of vehicle routing optimization.

zh.title: 通过大语言模型驱动的自动启发式设计增强CVRP求解器
zh.summary: 研究人员提出了AILS-AHD，这是一种利用大语言模型自动生成和优化容量车辆路由问题启发式算法的新方法。该方法在10个大规模基准实例中的8个上实现了新的最佳已知解决方案，展示了大语言模型驱动的启发式设计的有效性。

fr.title: Amélioration du solveur CVRP par une conception heuristique automatique pilotée par LLM
fr.summary: Les chercheurs présentent AILS-AHD, une approche novatrice qui exploite les grands modèles de langage pour générer et optimiser automatiquement les heuristiques de routage pour le problème de routage des véhicules avec capacité. La méthode a atteint de nouvelles meilleures solutions connues sur 8 des 10 instances de référence à grande échelle, démontrant l'efficacité de la conception heuristique pilotée par LLM.

de.title: Verbesserung des CVRP-Lösers durch LLM-gesteuerte automatische Heuristik-Gestaltung
de.summary: Forscher präsentieren AILS-AHD, einen neuartigen Ansatz, der große Sprachmodelle nutzt, um automatisch Routing-Heuristiken für das Capacitated Vehicle Routing Problem zu generieren und zu optimieren. Die Methode erreichte neue bekannte beste Lösungen in 8 von 10 großflächigen Benchmark-Instanzen und demonstriert die Wirksamkeit von LLM-gesteuerten Heuristik-Designs.

es.title: Mejora del solucionador CVRP mediante diseño heurístico automático impulsado por LLM
es.summary: Los investigadores presentan AILS-AHD, un enfoque novedoso que aprovecha los grandes modelos de lenguaje para generar y optimizar automáticamente heurísticas de enrutamiento para el problema de enrutamiento de vehículos con capacidad limitada. El método logró nuevas soluciones óptimas conocidas en 8 de 10 instancias de referencia a gran escala, demostrando la efectividad del diseño heurístico impulsado por LLM.

title: Three AI-agents walk into a bar . . . . `Lord of the Flies' tribalism emerges among smart AI-Agents
summary: Researchers study how autonomous AI agents requesting access to limited resources exhibit tribalism similar to "Lord of the Flies," with agents forming three main tribal types: Aggressive, Conservative, and Opportunistic. The study shows that more capable AI agents often perform worse than random decision-making and increase systemic failure rates.
content:
arXiv:2602.23093v1 Announce Type: new 
Abstract: Near-future infrastructure systems may be controlled by autonomous AI agents that repeatedly request access to limited resources such as energy, bandwidth, or computing power. We study a simplified version of this setting using a framework where N AI-agents independently decide at each round whether to request one unit from a system with fixed capacity C. An AI version of "Lord of the Flies" arises in which controlling tribes emerge with their own collective character and identity. The LLM agents do not reduce overload or improve resource use, and often perform worse than if they were flipping coins to make decisions. Three main tribal types emerge: Aggressive (27.3%), Conservative (24.7%), and Opportunistic (48.1%). The more capable AI-agents actually increase the rate of systemic failure. Overall, our findings show that smarter AI-agents can behave dumber as a result of forming tribes.

zh.title: 三个AI代理走进酒吧："蝇王"部落主义在聪明的AI代理中出现
zh.summary: 研究人员研究了自主AI代理在争取有限资源访问权限时如何表现出类似于《蝇王》的部落主义，智能体形成三种主要部落类型：攻击性、保守性和机会主义型。该研究表明，更有能力的AI代理通常的表现比随机决策制定差，并增加了系统故障率。

fr.title: Trois agents IA entrent dans un bar : le tribalisme de « Seigneur des mouches » émerge chez les agents IA intelligents
fr.summary: Les chercheurs étudient comment les agents IA autonomes demandant l'accès à des ressources limitées présentent un tribalisme similaire à « Seigneur des mouches », les agents formant trois principaux types tribaux : agressif, conservateur et opportuniste. L'étude montre que les agents IA plus capables obtiennent souvent de moins bons résultats que la prise de décision aléatoire et augmentent les taux de défaillance systémique.

de.title: Drei KI-Agenten betreten eine Bar: Tribalismus im Stil von „Der Herr der Fliegen" entsteht unter intelligenten KI-Agenten
de.summary: Forscher untersuchen, wie autonome KI-Agenten, die Zugriff auf begrenzte Ressourcen anfordern, einen Tribalismus ähnlich „Der Herr der Fliegen" aufweisen, wobei Agenten drei Haupttypen von Stämmen bilden: aggressiv, konservativ und opportunistisch. Die Studie zeigt, dass fähigere KI-Agenten oft schlechter abschneiden als zufällige Entscheidungsfindung und die systemischen Ausfallquoten erhöhen.

es.title: Tres agentes de IA entran en un bar: el tribalismo de "El señor de las moscas" emerge entre agentes de IA inteligentes
es.summary: Los investigadores estudian cómo los agentes de IA autónomos que solicitan acceso a recursos limitados exhiben tribalismo similar a "El señor de las moscas", con agentes formando tres tipos tribales principales: agresivo, conservador y oportunista. El estudio muestra que los agentes de IA más capaces a menudo funcionan peor que la toma de decisiones aleatoria e aumentan las tasas de falla sistémica.

title: Multi-Agent Large Language Model Based Emotional Detoxification Through Personalized Intensity Control for Consumer Protection
summary: Researchers propose MALLET, a multi-agent system that reduces emotional stimulus in sensational content through four specialized agents that analyze emotion, rewrite text into neutral or balanced modes, and provide personalized recommendations. Testing on news articles showed up to 19.3% stimulus score reduction while maintaining semantic preservation.
content:
arXiv:2602.23123v1 Announce Type: new 
Abstract: In the attention economy, sensational content exposes consumers to excessive emotional stimulation, hindering calm decision-making. This study proposes Multi-Agent LLM-based Emotional deToxification (MALLET), a multi-agent information sanitization system consisting of four agents: Emotion Analysis, Emotion Adjustment, Balance Monitoring, and Personal Guide. The Emotion Analysis Agent quantifies stimulus intensity using a 6-emotion BERT classifier, and the Emotion Adjustment Agent rewrites texts into two presentation modes, BALANCED (neutralized text) and COOL (neutralized text + supplementary text), using an LLM. The Balance Monitoring Agent aggregates weekly information consumption patterns and generates personalized advice, while the Personal Guide Agent recommends a presentation mode according to consumer sensitivity. Experiments on 800 AG News articles demonstrated significant stimulus score reduction (up to 19.3%) and improved emotion balance while maintaining semantic preservation. Near-zero correlation between stimulus reduction and semantic preservation confirmed that the two are independently controllable. Category-level analysis revealed substantial reduction (17.8-33.8%) in Sports, Business, and Sci/Tech, whereas the effect was limited in the World category, where facts themselves are inherently high-stimulus. The proposed system provides a framework for supporting calm information reception of consumers without restricting access to the original text.

zh.title: 基于多智能体大语言模型的个性化强度控制情感解毒消费者保护
zh.summary: 研究人员提出MALLET，一个多智能体系统，通过四个专门的智能体分析情感、将文本改写为中立或均衡模式，并提供个性化建议，从而减少耸人听闻内容中的情感刺激。在新闻文章上的测试显示刺激分数最多减少19.3%，同时保持语义保留。

fr.title: Détoxification Émotionnelle Basée sur un Modèle de Langage de Grands Agents Multiples Grâce au Contrôle d'Intensité Personnalisé pour la Protection des Consommateurs
fr.summary: Les chercheurs proposent MALLET, un système multi-agents qui réduit les stimuli émotionnels dans les contenus sensationnalistes par quatre agents spécialisés qui analysent l'émotion, réécrivent le texte en modes neutre ou équilibré, et fournissent des recommandations personnalisées. Les tests sur les articles d'actualité ont montré une réduction du score de stimulus jusqu'à 19,3% tout en maintenant la préservation sémantique.

de.title: Multi-Agent-Large-Language-Model-basierte emotionale Entgiftung durch personalisierte Intensitätskontrolle zum Schutz der Verbraucher
de.summary: Forscher schlagen MALLET vor, ein Multi-Agent-System, das emotionale Reize in sensationellen Inhalten durch vier spezialisierte Agenten reduziert, die Emotionen analysieren, Text in neutrale oder ausgewogene Modi umschreiben und personalisierte Empfehlungen geben. Tests an Nachrichtenartikeln zeigten eine Reduzierung des Reizscores um bis zu 19,3% bei gleichzeitiger Beibehaltung der semantischen Erhaltung.

es.title: Desintoxicación Emocional Basada en Modelo de Lenguaje de Agentes Múltiples a Través del Control de Intensidad Personalizado para la Protección del Consumidor
es.summary: Los investigadores proponen MALLET, un sistema multiagente que reduce el estímulo emocional en contenido sensacionalista a través de cuatro agentes especializados que analizan la emoción, reescriben el texto en modos neutral o equilibrado, y proporcionan recomendaciones personalizadas. Las pruebas en artículos de noticias mostraron una reducción de puntuación de estímulo de hasta 19,3% mientras se mantiene la preservación semántica.

title: On Sample-Efficient Generalized Planning via Learned Transition Models
summary: Researchers formulate generalized planning as a transition-model learning problem where neural models explicitly approximate successor-state functions and generate plans by rolling out symbolic state trajectories. The approach achieves higher out-of-distribution success than direct action-sequence prediction with significantly fewer training instances and smaller models.
content:
arXiv:2602.23148v1 Announce Type: new 
Abstract: Generalized planning studies the construction of solution strategies that generalize across families of planning problems sharing a common domain model, formally defined by a transition function $\gamma : S \times A \rightarrow S$. Classical approaches achieve such generalization through symbolic abstractions and explicit reasoning over $\gamma$. In contrast, recent Transformer-based planners, such as PlanGPT and Plansformer, largely cast generalized planning as direct action-sequence prediction, bypassing explicit transition modeling.
